title: Crew at Benson Camp
creator: John Fletcher Ford
description: A logging crew poses across railroad tracks between buildings at Benson Camp. Handwriting at the bottom of the photo includes location and date.
subject: Logging; Logging railroads; Workers; Lumber camps

title: Crew with Train at Benson Camp
creator: John Fletcher Ford
description: A logging crew poses on a slope amongst logs at Benson Camp. A train engine with a driver sits behind them. Handwriting at the bottom of the photo includes location and date.
subject: Logging; Logging railroads; Workers; Lumber camps; Railroad trains
source: Industries and Occupations Photographs - University of Washington Digital Collection

title: Bridal Veil Camp
creator: Unknown
description: A photo of workers, oxen, wooden buildings, and felled trees at Bridal Veil Camp. The photo is somewhat blurred. The Bridal Veil Lumbering Company logged on Larch Mountain and milled timber in the company towns of Palmer and Bridal Veil from 1886-1936.
subject: Logging; Workers; Lumber camps; Animals in logging
source: Industries and Occupations Photographs - University of Washington Digital Collection
citation: "Logging camp near Bridal Veil, Oregon, 1897," Unknown. 1897, University of Washington, Washington. University of Washington Digital Collections, Industries and Occupations Photographs, https://cdm16786.contentdm.oclc.org/digital/collection/indocc/id/736

title: Curtis Lumber Company Train
creator: Unknown
description: A Curtis Lumber Company logging train moves through the snow near Mill City, Oregon. Several men stand on the train. Handwriting at the bottom of the photo includes the date, location, and company.
subject: Logging; Logging railroads; Railroad trains; Workers
source: Clark County Historical Museum Photographs Collection - WSU Vancouver Library - Digital Collections
citation: "Curtis Lumber Company Logging Train," Unknown. 1908, Washington State University Vancouver Library, Washington. WSU Vancouver Library - Digital Collections, Clark County Historical Museum Photographs Collection, https://content.libraries.wsu.edu/digital/collection/cchm_photo/id/5720

title: Logging Near Clackamas
creator: Unknown
description: A group of loggers stand on logs and pose for a postcard photo. There are many fallen logs around them, some with tools stuck in them. Two horses stand near the workers. Handwriting at the bottom of the postcard reads "Logging near Clackamas, Ore. taken 1910."
subject: Logging; Workers; Animals in logging; Postcard; Forests and forestry—Equipment and supplies
source: Spokane, Portland, and Seattle Railway Photographs - Oregon Historical Society Digital Collections
citation: "Logging near Clackamas, Oregon," Unknown. 1910, The Oregon Historical Society, Oregon. Oregon Historical Society Digital Collections, Spokane, Portland, and Seattle Railway Photographs, https://digitalcollections.ohs.org/logging-near-clackamas-oregon

title: Riving Logs
creator: Unknown
description: Six men split a spruce log using wooden wedges and jacks. They use fiber cutting irons for the wood's strong grain. At the bottom of the photo it says "Warren Spruce Co., Portland, Ore."
subject: Logging; Forests and forestry—Equipment and supplies; Workers; Conifers
source: American Unofficial Collection of World War I Photographs - National Archives Catalogue
citation: "Industries of War - Lumber - Riving Logs in Oregon Forest," Unknown. 1918, U.S. National Archives and Records Administration, Maryland. National Archives Catalog, American Unofficial Collection of World War I Photographs, https://catalog.archives.gov/id/31490021

title: Map of Northwestern Clatsop County
creator: Richard Park
description: The map includes locations such as Blind Slough, Big Creek, Knappa Post Office, and an unnamed logging camp. At the bottom right of the map is an assesment of the roads, railroads, bridges, soil, and water quality. The surveyor also notes the location of a telegraph and that the timber in the area is mainly fir. Locations have labels like swampy, brush, virgin timber, and second growth.
subject: Forests and forestry—Maps; Logging railroads; Conifers; Lumber camps
source: War Department Map Collection - National Archives Catalogue
citation: "Topographical Map of Oregon Showing Hills with Timber, Logging Camps, Knappa Post Office, and a Rail Road," Richard Park. 1909, U.S. National Archives and Records Administration, Maryland. National Archives Catalogue, War Department Map Collection, https://catalog.archives.gov/id/148719479

title: Map of Northern Columbia County
creator: Richard Park
description: The map includes locations such as Delena, the Columbia River, Rinearson Slough, Beaver Creek, South Beaver Creek, Wilson Lumber Company, Portland Lumber Company, Kyser Post Office, and Hudson Post Office. At the top left of the map is an assesment of roads, railroads, bridges, streams, soil, and water quality. Locations have labels like burned, cleared, brush, dense brush, virgin timber, and second growth.
subject: Forests and forestry—Maps; Logging railroads
source: War Department Map Collection - National Archives Catalogue
citation: "Topographical Map of Oregon Showing South Beaver Creek, the Columbia River, and Logging Railroads," Richard Park. 1909, U.S. National Archives and Records Administration, Maryland. National Archives Catalogue, War Department Map Collection, https://catalog.archives.gov/id/148719523

title: Oral history interview with Richard F. Smith [Sound Recording 01]

title: A spruce log on a log jack
creator: Corydon P. Cronk
description: In this image, a spruce log is resting on a log jack. The sawmill where the photograph was taken is Smith Mill, located in what was once Marshfield, OR - known today as Coos Bay, OR.

title: Men surrounding a donkey engine
creator: Gerald W. Williams
description: The image shows several loggers standing around a donkey engine - a piece of equipment used to lift, drag, move, and load logs. In the background there are several trees that seem to have been cut down and several pieces of chopped wood. There are also two donkeys standing on the side of the men.
subject: Forests and forestry—Equipment and supplies; Logging; Animals in logging; Workers
source: Gerald W. Williams Collection - Oregon Digital
citation: "Men surrounding a donkey engine," Gerald W. Williams. 1915, Oregon State University Libraries and Press, Oregon. Oregon Digital, Gerald W. Williams Collection, https://oregondigital.org/concern/images/df66vb91k
